content.description: This route climbs the leftmost vertical crack on the slab. Most of it is currently (2011) filled with blueberry bushes, and the slab's highly-featured surface is, unfortunately, also covered with lichen.
content.protection: Dig out good cam, tricam, and hex placements in the vertical crack or one of several horizontal cracks you pass along the way. Bring a gear tool or some other implement to dig with.
content.location: Left of the top of the Bulwark block. It is possible to begin this route lower, in the low-angle dihedral left of the Bulwark block.

content.description: Low-angle slabs on the lefthand edge of the main face of the Wayout Wall.   The climbing is generally easy, ascending knobby slabs with either no protection or several excellent cracks.
